title: Kernel Explainer error on Yolo model, How to resolve it ??
body:
I am using Kernel Explainer on Yolo but it is giving error, how to resolve it ?
Error
```
IndexError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-225-5b480a873cc8> in <module>()
----> 1 e = kernel_explainer.shap_values(np.array(img_gray))

3 frames
/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/shap/utils/_legacy.py in <listcomp>(.0)
     85     if isinstance(data, DenseData):
     86         if instance.group_display_values is None:
---> 87             instance.group_display_values = [instance.x[0, group[0]] if len(group) == 1 else "" for group in data.groups]
     88         assert len(instance.group_display_values) == len(data.groups)
     89         instance.groups = data.groups

IndexError: index 160 is out of bounds for axis 1 with size 160
```
Code
```
img_org = cv2.imread("/content/image-mask-estimate/data/sample-images-india/1.jpg", cv2.IMREAD_COLOR)
#img_org = cv2.imread("data/images/false_positive.jpg", cv2.IMREAD_COLOR)
img_org = cv2.cvtColor(img_org, cv2.COLOR_BGR2RGB)
img = img_org.astype("float64")/255

plt.figure(figsize=(10, 10))
plt.imshow(img_org)
plt.show()

model = torch.hub.load('ultralytics/yolov5','custom', path_or_model='/content/best.pt')
detector1 = model.autoshape() 

class OD2Score(torch.nn.Module):
    def __init__(self):
        
        super(OD2Score, self).__init__()

    def forward(self, x):
        score_best_box = torch.zeros([len(x.xyxy),2], device=device)
        for idx, score in enumerate(x.xyxy):
          sum = 0
          if score.shape[0]:
            for i in range(score.shape[0]):
              sum+=x.xyxy[idx][i][4]
            sum = sum/score.shape[0]
          score_best_box[idx] = torch.tensor([sum])
  
        return score_best_box.cpu().numpy()

# look at the image output above and set the index of the object you want to analyze here
scoring = OD2Score()

class CastNumpy(torch.nn.Module):
  def __init__(self):
    super(CastNumpy, self).__init__()
  
  def forward(self, image):
    if len(image.shape) == 4:
      image = image.squeeze(0)
    return image

numpy2torch_converter = CastNumpy()

model = torch.nn.Sequential(
    numpy2torch_converter,
    detector1,
    scoring
)

exp_image = np.array(img_org)
exp_image = np.expand_dims(exp_image,axis=0)
kernel_explainer = shap.KernelExplainer(super_pixel_model,exp_image)

e = kernel_explainer.shap_values(np.array(img_gray))
```
